intro: Acourtia platyphylla, commonly known as the flatleaf acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically broad and flat, which gives it its common name. Acourtia platyphylla is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
